column3: {{c1::I've lost my phone. Have you seen it anywhere?}}
column4: I've lost my phone. Have you seen it anywhere? / I've lost my phone. I've found it now.

column3: {{c1::Sue has gone shopping. She'll be back around 4 o'clock.}}
column4: Sue has gone shopping. She's just come back. / Sue has gone shopping. She'll be back around 4 o'clock.

column3: {{c1::The trees have grown a lot. They're very tall now.}}
column4: The trees have grown a lot. So I cut them down. / The trees have grown a lot. They're very tall now.

column3: {{c1::I've forgotten his name. Is it Joe or Jack?}}
column4: I've forgotten his name. Is it Joe or Jack? / I've forgotten his name. I had to ask him and he told me.

column3: {{c1::Tom has applied for a job as a tour guide. He's waiting to hear from the tour company.}}
column4: Tom has applied for a job as a tour guide. Unfortunately he wasn't successful. / Tom has applied for a job as a tour guide. He's waiting to hear from the tour company.
Sarah has arrived. She's gone again now. / Sarah has arrived. She's here now.

column3: {{c1::The police have arrested three people. They're at the police station.}}
column4: The police have arrested three people. They're at the police station. / The police have arrested three people. Later all three were released.

column3: {{c1::Helen has hurt her foot. She can't walk properly.}}
column4: Helen has hurt her foot. But it's OK now. / Helen has hurt her foot. She can't walk properly.
